item.title: Soup kitchen on wheels named 'Angelmobile' serves North Brooklyn's poor
item.description: GREENPOINT, Brooklyn (WABC) – Food trucks are a staple of the fast-paced New York City lifestyle, but one Brooklyn food truck does more for the community than dishing out quick and delicious meals. The “Angelmobile” is a sort of a “soup kitchen on wheels,” said Neil Sheen, co-founder of the nonprofit North Brooklyn Angels. Originally, the North Brooklyn Angels served the Bedford-Stuyvesant community with a brick-and-mortar soup kitchen, St. John’s Bread of Life on Lexington Avenue, but in order to reach more people in need, they started thinking outside the box.
